osm
  • Automating large-scale simulations for OMNeT++

  • Command Line Interface
osm

merge module¶

merge.build_results_df(input_files_directory, filename, structure, iteration_parameters_list)[source]¶

Build dataframes from result files. In case of numeric types, dataframes are constructed accordingly Additional columns are add (filename, scenario, repetition) from the file name for grouping purposes.

merge.get_iteration_parameters(variables_path)[source]¶

Read iteration parameters from file as part of the structure

merge.get_parameters(eval_path)[source]¶

Return a list of structure_file to sort the results table. It must be consistent with gathered values in the project.

Structure in structure_file external file:

parm1,parm2,parm3,…..

merge.merge_files(input_files_directory, output_directory, output_filename, eval_path, max_processes, variables_path)[source]¶

Merge repetitions executed per scenario in one output file. Add statistics (mean, standard deviation).

Input: Directory with results files. File with evaluation structure_file (i.e., Parameters evaluated in project) Output: One output file (*.npy, *.mat *.csv).

merge.parse_if_number(s)[source]¶

Return a float, True/False or None

merge.save_simulation_results(sim_summary, output_directory, file_name)[source]¶

Export results to file to supported file extension. The extension must be included in the filename. By default .npy is selected.

Supported extensions:

.npy (Numpy file), .mat (Matlab file) or csv (Comma-separated values) by default

merge.wrapper_scavetool(input_files_directory, output_directory, output_filename)[source]¶

Try to convert scalar (.sca) and vector (.vec) statistics generated by OMNET++ tool scavetool.
